intro: Castalia reniformis, commonly known as the kidneyleaf castalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive kidney-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Castalia reniformis typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting various pollinators.
